result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Anthony Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office - 60 days to pay or setup payment plan.
Must provide DNA sample and pay $250 surcharge.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.  
No elective office.
Other civil rights lost until restored.  
If not US citizen may face deportation.
**No Contacts removed & added to 12CF397.  (Amended 8/12/16)**

Follow through with Compas evaluation and recommendations.  
Contact IS allowed with daughter.
Sex Offender Registry for 15 years.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Credit for 135 days = Time served. Subject to good time and work release.

Any outstanding financial obligations will be reduced to a civil judgment, made payable to the Clerk of Court's Office and subject to tax intercept and/or other collection efforts.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

records.addlTxt: Atty Steffen present in chambers for the State.  Atty Mark Biller present in chambers for the defendant.  Defendant does not appear.  KK Clerk 1:__ PM  In chambers Atty Biller and DA Steffen addresses polygraph test information in PSI.  Atty Biller States this is in violation.  DA Steffen agrees - agrees court to disregard (recommendation with information in PSI is issue)  Court - No refer. to polygraph during sentencing.  Any part that makes refer. will not be considered. adj. 2:15PM

Defendant Mark Anthony Perkins in court with attorney Mark Drew Biller.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 2:19PM  CASES:  12CF397 and 14CF306.  Atty Biller no errors - however consider accusation.  Def does have right to alter. PSI - Def wants to move forward today.  DA Steffen addresses quote made by Step mother in PSI - Steffen had no conversation with Def as such.  Jessica Dix (Victim) speaks to court.  Kay Stoeklen (Victim) speaks to court.  DA Steffen gives closing argument.  Agrees with recommendation of PSI writer.  Atty Biller gives closing argument.  Recess break 3:34PM  Back on the record at 4:03PM  

Finds def is not elig. for CIP and SA.  May not vote until civil rights are restored.  No elective office.  Other civil rights lost until restored.  No firearms. No Body armor.  If not US citizen may face deportation.    

14CF306 - sent w/held 3 years prob. Follow through with compas evaluation and recommendations.  No contact with females under 18 unless allowed with prob.  Allowed contact with daughter.  Sex Offender Regist.  15 years.  $290.60 costs.  DNA sample and surcharge of $250.  NPO contact with Jessica Dix and Kay Stoeklen.  Must report to Probation tomorrow.    

12CF397 - Counts 3 and 4 - - 9 months on each count.  Consecutive to each other.  Subject to WR and GT. 265.60 on each count.  No DNA sample or surcharge.  Must begin serving time by 02/27/2015 by 6pm.  PCR.  adj. 4:55PM
